name: contrarily
content:
contrarily adverb
(OPPOSITE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is the opposite of something: It was the wettest June since 1997 in England and Wales. Contrarily, the far north of Scotland was dry.contrarily to Contrarily to these claims, the number of crimes actually fell.
More examplesFewer examplesShe had a consciously analytical approach. Contrarily, he never gave much thought to how he worked.With this species, contrarily, it is the female who courts the male. Environmental threats include not only acid rain but also, contrarily, lack of rainfall.

contrarily adverb
(NOT REASONABLE)
in a way that is intended to disagree with and annoy other people: "I'm not a being difficult", she responded contrarily. The child contrarily refused to play.
More examplesFewer examples"I didn't smash my racket," she answered contrarily. He responded quite contrarily, "Why should I be worried?"She had contrarily thought that if he really cared he would have come running after her.
